abstract: Tenet said that it had instituted the defense plan to safeguard $2 billion worth of tax benefits arising from net operating losses it has incurred.
snippet: Tenet said that it had instituted the defense plan to safeguard $2 billion worth of tax benefits arising from net operating losses it has incurred.
lead_paragraph: 8:01 p.m. | Updated Tenet Healthcare, the hospital operator, said on Friday that it was adopting a shareholder rights plan to defend itself against an unsolicited $3.3 billion bid from a rival, Community Health Systems.

headline.main: Tenet Adopts Poison Pill as It Fights Community Health Bid

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
